pattern: Hi,Hello!,How are u?,How do u do?,Hlo
responses: Hello, Bot here ! How r u ?
Bye Buddy,Meet u again,Bye,Thanks for visiting !

pattern: what is online banking?,what is net banking?,about online banking,about net banking
responses: online banking is a tool that allows you to use a personal computer with an internet connection to conduct your banking online

pattern: what happens if i forget the password?,what to do if i lose my password?,when i forget the password how should i know the password ?,i forget my password
responses: when logging in click the box 'forget password'. the system will ask you to choose a pre-arranged method of delivery to you of a temporary secure acees code.this code will allow you entry to the system and you will be prompted to create a new password

pattern: is mobile banking is secure?,should i trust mobile banking?,how its secure?
responses: yes, mobile banking is secured by 128-bit secured socket layer encryption and multi-factor authentication. plus, you are not liable for fraudulent mobile transactions when you notify the bank within 60 days of the transaction first appearing on your statement and complay with security responsibilities. see our online banking service agreement for full terms and condition

pattern: what is the device and os supported by mobile banking?,which android version is supported for mobile banking?
responses: mobile banking app is supported on iOS version 7.0 and above, android version 4.4 and above.

pattern: what is bank insurance?,About bank insurance
responses: bank insurance help to protect individuals who deposit their savings in banks against commercial bank insolvency.each depositor is insured to at least $250,000 per bank.

pattern: what is inactive?,if we won't use our saving or current accout for a year what will happen?
responses: if you haven't used your savings or current account for any transaction for over 1 year, the account becomes inactive. if the account has been inactive for 2 years, it becomes doemant or inoperative

pattern: what is fixed deposit?,Details regarding Fixed deposit
responses: An fixed deposit (FD) account holds a lump sum amount as investment. the bank pays an interest is paid once the tenure of the FD is complete. upon breaking the FD in the middle of its tenure, consumers risk losin out on the interest often receive only the principle amount.

pattern: which douments are required for personal loans?
responses:
1. Proof of identity-passport/driving license/voters id/pan card
 2. proof of residence-leave and license agreement/utility bill/passport 
 3. salary slips for last 3 months 
 5 . passport size photograps 
 6. latest 3 months bank statement(where salary/income is credited

pattern: what is the age limit for opening the bank account?,shall we open bank account for children,then what is the age limit?
responses: banks have categorised savings bank account for children in two categories;one for those below the age of 10 and another for those in 10-18 age group

pattern: what are the types in bank account?,What about Account Types ? ,Different Account Types?
responses: 1.Current Account 2.Savings Account 3.Salary Account 4.Fixed Deposit Account 5.Recurring Deposit Account 6.NRI Account 7.Foreign Currency non-resident Account(FCNR)

pattern: how much amount should we save in savings account?,What is the minimum balance?
responses: There is no limit on how much money you keep in a savings account. But the money should be legally obtained and you should have proof of it

pattern: how much interest did we get from bank for having savings in bank?
responses: Interest rates:4% to 7.1%p.a based on daily balance

pattern: how should I calculate the interest ?
responses:
This is how we calculate the monthly interest for general savings account. monthly interest =daily balance*(number of days)*interest/(days in the year). assuming the daily balance is rs.3 lakhs and the interest on savings account is 4 per cent per annum.
 Monthly Interest = 3 lakhs *30*(4/100)/365 = Rs.986
